intro: Antiosorus, commonly known as the purple false nettle, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other nettle relatives. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive purple underside, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. Antiosorus is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it identifiable by its unique leaf coloration and growth habitat.
